note.p: Career: Migrated to Sydney, Australia, as a child; worked on geological survey of the New Hebrides; Lecturer in mineralogy and petrology, Adelaide University; accompanied Shackleton to the Antarctic (1907); made another Antarctic expedition (1911-1914); Professor of Geology, Adelaide University
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1959 vol 5 pp 119-127, plate, by A R Alderman and C E Tilley
References: G E Fogg, 'The Royal Society and the Antarctic' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 85-98
Notes: DSB gives death date as 14 October 1958
